intro: Polygonum minus var. interruptum, commonly known as the redstem filaree, is a low-growing perennial herb native to the western United States. It features slender, branching stems that are typically reddish in color, especially when mature. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in late summer to early fall. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in sunny, well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and fields.
